description: Mail client with amazing privacy and a plethora of features
Doesn't do spell check like previous version, for the life of me, can't figure how to get this version to "see" aspell.

Unfortunately, while I really loved this application years ago, the inability to use it with modern internet realities (OAuth2 is not working, inadequate HTML support for emails from people I can't (or won't) ignore, no integration with contacts from DAV or Outlook, etc) makes it unusable for me at the present time.
summary: Great app, but needs to face reality of modern internet

description: I like Claws because of the privacy and security. But, there are some issues that may prevent me from using it on my high DPI display. Icons are too small and look out of place. As others mention, some features don't work right. But, I was able to get logged into my account and download mail. I don't think flatpak is the best version of this app either.
Die GUI muss angepasst werden, damit es sich halbwegs in modernes GNOME passt. Dafür sehr schnell, funktionsreich und anpassungsfähig. Nachrichtenfilter sind sehr mächtig.
